description: From Ancient Greek μόλυβδος (mólubdos, “lead”) and the suffix -mancy. Probably after Greek μολυβδομαντεία (molybdomanteia) or French molybdomancie.

entries.meaning: divination by interpreting shapes formed when molten metal, typically lead or tin, is dropped into water.
examples: MOLUBDOMANCY [molybdomanteia of molybdos Lead, and manteia Divination, Gr.] a divining, an observing the motions, Figures, &c. of melted Lead.
